#summary Developing YTEX with eclipse

= Introduction =

== Build ==
  * Checkout
    ** Setup Repository 
    ** Right Click on workspace -> find / checkout as -> find projects in the children of the selected resource
  * Setup Workspace Preferences: Window -> Preferences
    ** Server -> Runtime Environment -> Add -> Apache Tomcat v6.0
    ** Java -> Build Path -> Classpath Variables -> New -> MAVERIC_HOME
    ** Ant -> Runtime -> Properties -> 
       *** maveric.home
       *** ytex.properties ${workspace_loc}/config.local/src/ytex.properties
  * create project config.local
  will hold environment-specific configuration
    ** Setup ytex.properties
  * Copy sqljdbc_3.0 to libs.system
  * Setup Maveric
    ** Execute setupMavericResources target in build/build-setup.xml
    ** Refresh Maveric
  * Setup config files: execute templateToConfig in build/build-setup.xml
  * Select all projects -> Right Click -> Refresh
  Now everything should compile.

== Tomcat setup ==
  * Open Servers tab, Add Tomcat Server, Add ytex.web to server
  * Open Server -> Open Launch Configuration
    ** Environment: add PATH=${workspace_loc}/libs.system/sqljdbc_3.0/enu/auth/x86
    ** Arguments: add
    -Djava.util.logging.config.file=file:///${workspace_loc}/config/desc/Logger.properties 
    -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager
    -Dorg.apache.el.parser.COERCE_TO_ZERO=false
    ** Classpath: Add libs.system to server classpath

  


Everything should work
